subject: [PATCH] mm: name the anonymous MMOP enum as enum mmop

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jonathan Cameron noted that the patch does not address the issue of the MMOP enum being anonymous, which can lead to compiler warnings about implicit conversions between enums and integers.
reviews.raw_body:
On Wed, 11 Feb 2026 16:54:47 -0500
Gregory Price <gourry@gourry.net> wrote:

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch does not contain any functional changes and is a clean-up effort, thus no further review or testing is required.
reviews.raw_body:
Reviewed-by: Jonathan Cameron <jonathan.cameron@huawei.com>

Thanks for cleaning this up!

J

2026-02-19.patch_summary: This patch renames the anonymous MMOP enum to 'enum mmop' to allow the compiler to catch invalid assignments of values to variables of this type. The existing functions returning int are left unchanged, and the uint8_t buffer in offline_and_remove_memory() is kept as-is for space efficiency. The enum definition is moved before the CONFIG_MEMORY_HOTPLUG guard to ensure it's available for struct memory_block in memory.h. This patch makes no functional changes.

reviews.author: Cheatham, Benjamin
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch was already reviewed and improved upon in another set of patches, but still requested a Reviewed-by tag
sentiment_signals: reviewer appreciated previous review and improvement
reviews.raw_body:
I saw this when reviewing another set of yours and thought about mentioning it, glad you cleaned it up!

One small nit below, otherwise:
Reviewed-by: Ben Cheatham <benjamin.cheatham@amd.com>

reviews.author: Cheatham, Benjamin
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the comment 'Comment looks unaligned' is not relevant to the patch's technical content and does not provide any specific feedback on the code changes.

2026-02-11.patch_summary: This patch renames the anonymous MMOP enum to 'enum mmop' to allow the compiler to catch invalid assignments of values to variables of this type. The existing functions returning int are left unchanged, and the uint8_t buffer in offline_and_remove_memory() is kept as-is for space efficiency. The enum definition is moved before the CONFIG_MEMORY_HOTPLUG guard to ensure it's available for struct memory_block in memory.h. This patch makes no functional changes.

reviews.author: Gregory Price (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledges that the enum definition is already unaligned, but suggests it might not be worth reordering in a new version (v2) unless reviewer Andrew prefers it.
reviews.raw_body:
Ah yeah was already unaligned. Bleh.

Probably not worth a full v2 unless Andrew prefers that.

~Gregory
